column4: it sounds like you don't want to run GNOME at all, in which case, don't
you are running at least some GNOME components, apparently
How do I get rid of it then?
what session did you select when logging into gdm?
if you run 'ps ux', you'll likely find that you have a bunch of gnome-related processes running
if you don't want GNOME, don't run the control center.  that will start gnome-settings-daemon, set up shortcuts, etc.
I kill all the gnome related processes.
you'll want to log out to make sure that everything is stopped
Only gnome process I see is gconfd-2
it works fine for me, simply selecting fluxbox as the session
